prop.head.headtext: Thorburn, Law of Confidential Business Information

prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Confidential Business Information in Historical Context

para.paratext: Whether information should be protected in a given case should depend upon the circumstances surrounding the plaintiff's claimed property interest, the nature of the relationship involved and/or the defendant's alleged violation of business ethics. The policy reasons invoked to protect confidential information ought to involve the balancing of the strength of the right to information with public policy interests in the encouragement of business ethics and the dissemination of information.

Although the rules for the protection of confidential business information may not always provide an incentive to individual investors or produce a just and equitable result, the protection of confidential business information is often required to produce a return on investment and an incentive to invest in new ideas. However, although the resources devoted to creations outside the scope of existing patents have resulted in valuable additional innovations, it is impossible to know what other innovations would have been made if information were freely available.
